Toggle Menu

salt.modules.win_groupadd

Manage groups on Windows

add

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.add(
								name,
								gid=None,
								system=False
								)

Details

Add the specified group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.add foo

adduser

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.adduser(
								name,
								username
								)

Details

add a user to a group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.adduser foo username

delete

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.delete(
								name
								)

Details

Remove the named group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.delete foo

deluser

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.deluser(
								name,
								username
								)

Details

remove a user from a group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.deluser foo username

getent

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.getent(
								refresh=False
								)

Details

Return info on all groups

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.getent

info

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.info(
								name
								)

Details

Return information about a group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.info foo

list_groups

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.list_groups(
								useldap=False
								)

Details

Return a list of groups on Windows

set 'useldap' to True to connect to the local LDAP server

members

Syntax

salt.modules.win_groupadd.members(
								name,
								members_list
								)

Details

remove a user from a group

CLI Example:

salt '*' group.members foo 'user1,user2,user3'

if using LDAP DNs, usernames must be seperated with a ", "

salt '*' group.members name='cn=foo,dc=domain,dc=com' members_list='cn=user1,cn=Users,dc=domain,dc=com, cn=user2,ou=Test,dc=domain,dc=com'
